hero.name: Cándido Aguilar
hero.description: My approach combines backend robustness with the agility of modern architectures.

about.paragraph1: Full stack Developer with a solid focus on creating scalable and secure applications. My professional career has focused on developing critical platforms for managing government procedures and international consular services.

about.paragraph2: I have built complex workflows for the acquisition of official documents and visas, ensuring data integrity in high-security environments and integrating large-scale financial systems such as payment gateways and SAP ecosystems.

about.paragraph3: Outside the professional environment, I am passionate about exploring modern architectures. I apply patterns like Hexagonal Architecture and DDD in my personal projects, experimenting with cloud-native technologies and asynchronous messaging systems like Kafka.

experience.description: Development and maintenance of a critical large-scale government services platform for managing international procedures and transactions.
details: Development of architecture and technical evolution of government platforms.
Integration of payment gateways and E2E user flows (UI to Backend).
Backend with Groovy/Grails and build automation with Gradle.
Dynamic interfaces with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, TypeScript, and Bootstrap.
Deployment and management of WAR applications on Apache Tomcat servers.
Version control and technical collaboration using GitHub.

experience.description: Development of systems for consular and internal management, integrating SAP ecosystems and optimizing document processes in high-security environments.
details: Backend development with Java, Groovy, and Grails (v2 to v5) under MVC architecture.
Digitization of consular procedures and management of administrative flows.
Development of monitoring panels and internal management tools.
Integration and synchronization of data with SAP business systems.
Optimization of processes for the validation of official documentation.
Maintenance and deployment of WAR applications on Linux servers.
Implementation of payment gateways in highly critical systems.

experience.position: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science in Software Engineering
details: Developed a local-first medical assistance system using proximity-based communication between mobile and physical hardware (Snips) without internet dependency; the technological foundation for the 'Acho' assistant at University of Extremadura (UEx).
